metadata.title: CVE-2021-3621 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in SSSD, where the sssctl command was vulnerable to shell command injection via the logs-fetch and cache-expire subcommands. This flaw allows an attacker to trick the root user into running a specially crafted sssctl command, such as via sudo, to gain root access. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality, integrity, as well as system availability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-3621` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libipa-hbac0 - 2.4.1-2ubuntu4
libnss-sss - 2.4.1-2ubuntu4
libpam-sss - 2.4.1-2ubuntu4
libsss-certmap0 - 2.4.1-2ubuntu4
libsss-idmap0 - 2.4.1-2ubuntu4

libsss-sudo - 2.4.1-2ubuntu4
